{"step_by_step_thinking": "Rosettes are a histological finding characterized by a circular arrangement of cells around a central lumen. They can be seen in various types of tumors. Retinoblastoma is a malignant tumor of the retina and can show Flexner-Wintersteiner rosettes. Neurocysticercosis is a parasitic infection caused by the larval stage of the pork tapeworm and does not typically show rosettes. PNET (primitive neuroectodermal tumor) is a type of malignant tumor that can occur in various locations in the central nervous system and can show Homer-Wright rosettes. Medulloblastoma is a type of PNET that arises in the cerebellum and can also show Homer-Wright rosettes.", "answer_choice": "C. PNET"}
